column4: gpodder: sqlite3.OperationalError: unable to open database file - any help?
I normaly use mysql but sounds like maybe you didn't create the database or maybe you didn't give the app the priv to open it.
it seems to be broken - i could open it some hours ago
is the sqlite3 running?
how to find out?
does it run on the same box?  is it on the lan network?
its my desktop machine
so the app and sqlite3 must run on the same box.  so ps -A  and see if sqlite is seen in the list
it is not
well take a look in /etc/init.d  and see if you can find it and restart it
its not there
is it installed?  take a look at synaptic and see if it's checked.
no anything seems to has it deinstalled
but it still does not appear in init.d
it wouldn't apear in the dir /etc/init.d/ if it's not installed
or maybe sqlite doesn't start at boot?
i just reinstalled it
it might use sysv to start at boot?
how to simply start it
can you run sqlite3 at the command prompt?
